formalMetadata.description: A document with an image map: the alt attribute of the img element identifies the image and conveys the same information, but the alt attributes of the image map's area elements are empty.
formalMetadata.title: Alternative text for areas in client-side image maps: img element with image map; empty alt attributes in image map areas

testElement.specReference: How to create client-side image maps
Client-side image maps: the map and area elements

purpose.p: This test case is intended to fail because the image map areas have no text alternatives. Based on the description above the image and the image's text alternative, a screen reader user might deduce that the three areas are for the three colours (mentioned in the alt text) of the traffic sign, but a screen reader does not necessarily read the colours from top to bottom if the source code order of the image map areas is not the same as the order of the colours.

functionalOutcome.p: The image has a text description but none of the areas in the image map has a text description.

techComment.p: The img element has an alt attribute. However, since each of the area elements in the map element has an empty alt attribute, this case does not pass.
This test case is identical to sc1.1.1_l1_008, except that the alt attributes of the area elements are now empty.
This test case does not map to a WCAG 2.0 technique or failure.
(In Mozilla 1.7.3, SeaMonkey 1.1, Firefox 1.0, 1.5 and 2.0, the map does not work if the map element has only an id and no name attribute.)
